intro: Tragia schinzii, commonly known as the spiny pincushion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiny branches and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are usually small, oval, and covered with fine hairs. Tragia schinzii is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
